summary: HeaderMeasurements was updated to compute hasWeeklyData/hasMonthlyData, conditionally render Weekly/Monthly blocks only when data exists, and return null (collapse) when neither has data. This removes any "No data yet" fallback, but also hides the Weekly/Monthly labels when their respective data is missing (even if the other section has data), which conflicts with REQ-1/REQ-2 label-visibility acceptance criteria.

missing_requirements.requirement: When there is no Weekly measurements data, do not render the fallback text "No data yet" under the "Weekly" label, and keep the "Weekly" label visible unless both Weekly and Monthly have no data.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff hides the entire Weekly section when there is no weekly data (renders nothing), instead of keeping the "Weekly" label visible and merely removing the "No data yet" text (except when both are empty per REQ-3).

missing_requirements.requirement: When there is no Monthly measurements data, do not render the fallback text "No data yet" under the "Monthly" label, and keep the "Monthly" label visible unless both Weekly and Monthly have no data.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff hides the entire Monthly section when there is no monthly data (renders nothing), instead of keeping the "Monthly" label visible and merely removing the "No data yet" text (except when both are empty per REQ-3).

hallucinated_features.description: Modified project tracking metadata (project_state.json) to include new_feature_requests entries/status unrelated to the UI change request.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asked for UI behavior changes in the Dashboard header measurements display; it did not request changes to project tracking/state files.
